description: A capstone seminar for seniros in the major annd concentration, this course involves intensive
sttudy of special topics utilizing student research projects and presentations and relying on
the disciplinary expertise gained from their major and courses within the envornmental studies
concentration. Often the topic is a local or regional enviornmental issue, providing
partcipants with opportunities to interact with government and regulatory agencies and
community groups.  Prerequisites: Enviornmental Studies 137, senior status, or permission of
the environmental studies directof and instructor. Offered Spring Semester.
